item.title: Completionist cape when you are 99 in all skills
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

		int hasA99 = 0;//This int is used to count how many 99s
		int[] skills = {99,99,99};//The data (Used for demonstration..
		for(int i = 0; i <24; i++){//loop through all 24 skills..
			if(i != 23 && skills[i] == 99){//if i not equal to 23, and the skills[i] has 99
				hasA99++;//Add 1 point to the int that counts your 99s
			}
		}
		if(hasA99 >= 24){//24 because there are skill ID's 0-24 (that's 25) subtract one for skill ID 23 (that makes 24)
			//Take money and shit here...
		}

The above code is just a concept.

item.title: Completionist cape when you are 99 in all skills
item.dc:creator: @penguinimp penguinimp
item.description:
@penguinimp wrote:

fairly certain that could be a bug. IF any skill is 99, make eligible true.
That doesn’t look right.

    boolean eligible = false;

    for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
        if (i != 23 && c.playerLevel[i] == 99)
            eligible = true;
    }

If one fails, it just doesn’t make it false.

Instead start out true and make false if one of them is not 99, or in this case less then 99. Incase you have a skill that surpasses 99.
better to code thinking with the possibility of something then to not code it, and have to recode later.

    boolean eligible = true;

    for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
        if (i != 23 && c.playerLevel[i] < 99)
            eligible = false;
    }

Read full topic
item.source: Completionist cape when you are 99 in all skills

item.title: Completionist cape when you are 99 in all skills
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[code=Java]case 8517:
final int PRICE = 50000000;
boolean eligible = false;

for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) {
    if (i != 23 && c.playerLevel[i] == 99)
        eligible = true;
}

if (eligible && c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, PRICE)) {
    c.getItems().deleteItem(995, PRICE);
    c.getItems().addItem(19812, 1);
    c.sendMessage("Jack Frost recognizes your talents and hands you the Completionist cape.");
} else if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, PRICE)) {
    c.sendMessage("You do not have enough coins to pay for the cape.");
    c.sendMessage("You need " + PRICE + " coins.");
} else {
    c.sendMessage("You need level 99 in all skills for the Completionist cape!");
}
break;

[/code]should work

item.title: Completionist cape when you are 99 in all skills
item.dc:creator: @overload_sam overload sam
item.description:
@overload_sam wrote:

case 8517: // Jack Frost
final int COMPLETIONIST_CAPE_PRICE = 500000000; // 500M
boolean eligible = true;

        for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) { // Looping through stats to see if any skill is not 99
                if (c.playerLevel[i] != 99) {
                        eligible = false;
                }
        }
       
        if (eligible && c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, COMPLETIONIST_CAPE_PRICE)) {
                c.getItems().deleteItem(995, COMPLETIONIST_CAPE_PRICE); // Removing the money (id, amount)
                c.getItems().addItem(19812, 1); // Giving the cape (id, amount)
                c.sendMessage("Jack Frost recognizes your talents and hands you the Completionist cape."); // Message
        } else if (!c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, COMPLETIONIST_CAPE_PRICE)) {
                c.sendMessage("You do not have enough coins to pay for the cape.");
                c.sendMessage("You need " + COMPLETIONIST_CAPE_PRICE + " coins.");
        } else {
                c.sendMessage("You need level 99 in all skills for the Completionist cape!");
        }
    break;

Currently i have all that working but i have disabled Dungonering skill id 23 but the only problem is skill id 24 is construction so how could i make it so players can still get the cape as long as all skill ids 1-22 and skill id 24 are 99 but with skill id 23 being only 1?

Read full topic
